alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 11:46PM CDT until June 18 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1146 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles east of Stroud to 2 miles west of Earlsboro, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Paden... Grayson... Bearden... Hoffman... Castle... Clearview... Preston... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Welty... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 243. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
